name: Introduction to Writing Fiction
long_desc: This is an introduction to the reading and writing of short fiction. Character development and the creation of scenes will be the principal goals in the writing of short stories during the course of the semester. Revisions of the stories will constitute a major part of the final grade. Reading assignments will illustrate the different elements of fiction reviewed and practiced, and students will analyze and discuss stories from a writers point of view.

custom_fields.goals: Section A BTo help students become better and more creative writers, and to help them read more deeply, with a better understanding of form. To inspire you to create your own fiction, while deepening your analysis and appreciation of contemporary stories and novels.To experiment with characterization, sense of place, point of view, plot, use of imagery, metaphor, and dialogue.To help you Identify the progress you make as a result of disciplined writing practice.
custom_fields.key_topics: Section A: Narrative, Structure, Prose, Critical Thinking, Analysis, Close Reading
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Section A & B: Written responses to readings, class discussion, self-reflection, critiques, revision based on comments given on student writing. Portfolio of student writing often presented at term's end.
